Award.AbstractNarration:
The broader impact/commercial potential of this Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) project is to optimize water utilization, thereby improving agricultural production. It is projected that the human population will exceed 9 billion by 2050. To meet the expected demand, global food production must increase by more than 50% by 2050. This SBIR project will have impact not only in expanding fundamental knowledge of plant utilization of water but also in contributing to agricultural productivity, an urgent and practical need for human survival, in a sustainable manner.

This SBIR Phase I project proposes to commercialize the advanced water-treatment technology that could enhance plant growth, and therefore improve crop output in agricultural applications. In short, a thin layer (about 100 microns, as thin as a human hair) of interfacial water was found to exist with a slightly higher pH, net negative charge, and a tendency to exclude impurities. These findings were similar to those found by other independent research groups working with xylem cells in plants and muscle cells in animals. Several hydrogels and polymers were also found to contain interfacial water with similar properties. Initial studies regarding the practical use of the interfacial water were conducted in a plant system. On average, initial results show a rapid growth rate of around 10% to 20% improvement compared to the control group; preliminary findings that have now been confirmed to be similar amongst four different plants, namely chick pea, wheatgrass, basil, and pea shoots. This SBIR will enable continued testing and scale up the interfacial water generator to meet water demands for customer validations.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

POR.DRECONTENT:
All humans need water to survive. We cannot last more than about 3 days without water. By molecular count, water comprises over 99% of our body, so of course, it must be replenished often for the proper functioning of our biological systems. But there are no sources of water that are proven to have therapeutic effects beyond simple hydration. The answer to the question, “What is the healthiest water to drink?” is unclear. 4th-Phase, Inc. will manufacture and sell a home drinking water system that will produce 4th Phase water which we believe answers the question clearly and with scientific proof: 4th Phase water is the healthiest, most therapeutic water that you can drink. 4th Phase water already exists in our bodies, inside our cells and as a lining to our vascular system. Dr. Gerald Pollack, in his book The Fourth Phase of Water, outlines the theories and evidence that explain why this type of water is important for blood flow in our vascular system and energy generation in our cells. A detailed understanding of the health benefits of 4th Phase water is not new; 4th Phase water was discovered 20 years ago. 4th-Phase, Inc. will make 4th Phase water and its health benefits commercially available for the first time. 

 

Drinking 4th Phase water will provide far more than just hydration. It will enhance our health and vitality by improving our blood flow and oxygenation of our cells. It will be part of a set of solutions that will make improved health affordable and available to everyone. The rising cost of healthcare is a huge challenge for everyone on the planet, and we plan to help address this challenge.

 

We will manufacture and sell a home drinking water system that will purify tap water and then convert it into 4th Phase water. A point of use system is the preferred method of delivery; we believe the current popular trend of selling bottled water is damaging our planet. The carbon footprint resulting from shipping water is very high, and the pollution caused by plastic and other packaging materials is poisoning our ecology. 

 

The impact of providing affordable drinking water that also has scientifically proven health benefits cannot be overestimated.  It could dramatically improve health on a widespread, global scale by improving the function of some of our basic biological processes (such as blood flow in capillaries to improve oxygenation and nutrient delivery to all tissues).
